definitions.definition: To present (an argument or a plea), especially in a legal case.
definitions.example: The defendant has decided to plead not guilty.
He pleaded with me not to leave the house.

definitions.definition: To offer by way of excuse.
definitions.example: Not wishing to attend the banquet, I pleaded illness.

definitions.definition: The act of making a plea.
A document filed in a lawsuit, particularly a document initiating litigation or responding to the initiation of litigation.
